description: [Status: stable] [Name: request-without-timeout] [Message: Probable use of {module} call without timeout] What it does Checks for uses of the Python requests or httpx module that omit the timeout parameter. Why is this bad? The timeout parameter is used to set the maximum time to wait for a response from the server. By omitting the timeout parameter, the program may hang indefinitely while awaiting a response. Example import requests requests.get("https://www.example.com/") Use instead: import requests requests.get("https://www.example.com/", timeout=10)
